page.t: \033YQuirks
\033YSWM3 Faction Dossiers

The Galactic Empire tends to have many powerful military fleets over the course of your entire playthrough. Especially their Rearguard and Border Patrol squadrons are solid, which can't be said for many other factions. This generally makes their defense very stable.
But their fleets are quite slow on the galactic level and they often have to deal with rebellious sectors, which are far apart and have to be reconquered. Their military campaigns often involve seemingly unstoppable invasion fleets but long travel times. They are strong, but predictable.


If you want to go into a permanent war with this faction before you have a strong player empire, then keeping your sectors at a great distance to theirs is probably your best and only viable survival strategy.

\033G+++ consistently strong military
\033G++ special lategame event
\033G+ slightly larger starting territory

\033R-- sectors more likely to defect
\033R- slow fleets
\033R- often busy hunting Rebels

The New Republic suffers from low ship numbers in their squadrons due to crew shortages during the early and midgame of your playthrough. But they absolutely have the potential to grow into a real powerhouse during the lategame, where they immediately receive multiple huge buffs and instant benefits.


This faction is supposed to give you a lot of freedom in how you want to tackle them. They can be a very easy early target to steal a few good sectors from, or an ally for a roleplay challenge run.
In some rare cases they might even need your help to survive and see the lategame \(altough that should be super rare and would need to involve the Sith\)
In most cases they should survive. This faction is part of a big war in the lategame where many factions merge together into 2 blocks of power.
If you don't want this you can prevent it altogether by annihilating the New Republic during the midgame stage.

\033G++++ best lategame fleets and production
\033G++ special lategame event
\033G+ many powerful ship designs

\033R--- low ship numbers until lategame
\033R- slightly smaller starting territory

Overall the Rebel Alliance probably has the weakest, but most mobile fleets. Their hidden hyperlane network allows them to travel quickly.

The Rebels are generally always on the run, especially from Imperial Battlegroups and they usually loose in big battles.
But they frequently get reinforced with new sectors which defect from other factions to join their cause. This creates a very fractured and isolated faction which seems to "wander" on the galaxy map as the game goes on. They are very hard to wipe out.

This faction will start to die during the lategame, when it slowly merges with the New Republic.


If you plan a permanent war with the Rebel Alliance be prepared to face an enemy who is much tougher than his very few sectors might indicate. Conquering a rebel sector is no easy task due to them responding so quickly.
And there is no place where your sectors will be safe from their invasions. Their fleets are not the strongest and might not threaten your existence, but they can become really annoying.
And then you can also have entirely new rebel sectors suddenly popping up next to you, providing them with additional destinations to jump to.

This guerilla faction can only be defeated by wiping out every single rebel sector before the next batch wants to join them, or by reaching the lategame.

\033G+++ new random sectors join frequently
\033G++ hyperjump between all Outposts
\033G++ efficient production \(secret donations\)
\033G+ not invaded even if slightly larger
\033G+ deep strikers

\033R--- weak fleets, especially at gamestart
\033R-- special lategame event
\033R-- very small and scattered territory
\033R- never ignored by Imperial Battlegroups

The Separatist Confederacy of Independent Systems is a swarmer type faction with a heavy focus on deploying masses of cheap droid fighters. This provides the bulk of their forces with unusually high damage output, but also makes them fragile and keeps their ship production running almost constantly.
Later they also get a lot of capships, but the swarmer focus remains throughout your playthrough.
The CIS doesn't have any strong or weak phases and generally just ramps its power up when the player triggers a new phase.


Some of their offensive fleets like Task Forces can consist of fighters only, which makes them annoying enemies who are very efficient in taking out soft targets like your satellites, freighters or jump beacons.

The Republic is the most erratic faction in the game. It starts out as an economic powerhouse with a vast starting territory, but a pacifist fleet doctrine which is loosely based on the "Rusaan Reformation" from the lore.

This weakness gets resolved during the midgame, where the Republic will perform the most intense military buildup of all factions. With huge boosts to their production efficiency and desired fleet sizes. But actually building all these new ships will take very long, leaving them vulnerable for huge territorial losses during the early- and the beginning of the midgame.

The lategame completely dooms this faction. It will become extremely inefficient and starts to slowly merge together with the Galactic Empire.


A permanent war against the Republic can be tempting, but it is often a huge trap.
They start out super weak and you can literally take their sectors by force very early in the game. But the large starting territory makes it highly unlikely that you manage to completely cripple the entire faction before they can pull off their intense midgame buildup. And after this point you may get overwhelmed by a relentless wall of Venators.
So keep your options alive and don't declare a permanent war just yet. But attacking them is often worth it! You can win lots of good sectors this way. And their early Battlegroups are pathetic. Early on you don't need to fear their invasions!
